Settings.twoFactorAlreadyEnableDescription: Two-factor authentication is currently enabled on your account.
Settings.twoFactorSettingsDescription: Enhance your account security with two-factor authentication. Once enabled, simply enter a unique code from your mobile device along with your password during sign-in for added protection.
Settings.twoFactorDisableDialogTitle: Are you sure you want to disable two-factor authentication?
Settings.twoFactorDisableDialogMessage: Two-factor authentication increases the security of your account. Are you sure you want to disable it? You can enable it again at any time.
Settings.twoFactorEnableDialogTitle: Are you sure you want to enable two-factor authentication?
Settings.twoFactorEnableDialogMessage: Upon enabling two-factor authentication, you will be required to enter a unique code from your mobile device in addition to your password when signing in.
Settings.twoFactorToastInfoMessage: You can now use the form below to enable two-factor authentication.
Settings.twoFactorFormStepOne: Get an authentication app by downloading it on your mobile device. Example:
Settings.twoFactorFormStepTwo: Scan the QR code or enter the secret key into your authentication app.
Settings.twoFactorFormStepThree: Enter the 6-digit code from the app to enable two-factor authentication.
